name: Brier Inn and Conference Ctr.

reviews.text: My in-laws live in this area, so it is a regular place for the overflow during holiday visits. There are many places to stay in Lewisburg, but I sleep as well on these beds as any of them. The rooms are very clean, and I have never had any trouble with internet as they have wifi notebook. Fires right up.
reviews.title: Clean and comforitable beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My favorite place to stay in Lewisburg is NOT the Greenbrier. My favorite is the General Lewis Inn. Its SOOOO cool.
reviews.title: Ok for a stop-over

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From a budgetary perspective, though, it's the Brier. Stay here. You will sleep well because you won't break the bank as well as because of the nice beds.
reviews.title: Like a nice Days Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were traveling through and stopped here for the night. The price was good and the room was reasonably clean, but the room was run down and in need of upgrades. The internet did not work and I had some concerns about the outside door. We were on the first floor and just did not feel safe,
reviews.title: Affordable and comfortable overnight stop

likes.liked: — How affordable and close to the freeway.

aka: Brier Inn And Conference Ctr. Hotel Lewisburg
